newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunis bourse inaugurates computer trading system.
newsitem.headline: Tunis bourse inaugurates computer trading system.

text.p: The Tunis Stock Exchange on Monday inaugurated its computerised trading system which French exchange officials described as the first system of its kind to be installed in an emerging market.

"It is the first installation in an emerging market of the Paris Bourse system called SUPERCAC, which I believe is the most up to date one in the world," Paris bourse chairman Jean Francois Theodore said at the official ceremony.

The system was introduced on the Paris bourse in June 1995, he said. "The version installed at the Tunis bourse is an adaptable one to be used in whatever environment to ensure transparency and efficiency," he added.
The modern dealing and settlement system was supported by a French government grant announced during President Jacques Chirac's visit to Tunisia last year.
Thirty firms are listed on the Tunis Stock Exchange. All of them will be traded on the new system by the end of January, said bourse head Mohamed Hadouej.
After two years of explosive growth the Tunis share market has spent the last 12 months going nowhere.
But market officials say the market downturn is the price of a soft landing after rocketing growth and they hope computerised dealing will boost trading by improving transparency.
